name: European Committee for Interoperable Systems
memberOrga: Our members are IBM, Kolab Systems, Oracle Corporation, Opera Software ASA, Red Hat Inc., Real Networks, Corel.  More information available here: http://www.ecis.eu/about-ecis/.
goal: ECIS is an international non-profit association founded in 1989 that endeavours to promote a favourable environment for interoperable ICT solutions. It has actively represented its members regarding issues related to interoperability and competition before European, international and national fora, including the EU institutions and WIPO.
interests: Competition, Consumer Affairs, Enterprise, Information Society, Internal Market, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Research and Technology, Trade
euInitiatives:
ECIS is involved in the following activities:
• The European Commission Communication on a Digital Single Market (DSM) strategy for Europe (the "DSM Communication");
• The actions related to "building a data economy" including the European Commission's proposal for a European 'free flow of data' initiative as foreseen by the DSM Communication;
• The actions related to cyber security (e.g. NIS implementation / related EU guidance, Public Private Partnership ("PPP") activities, and Cyber-Security Strategy revision);
• The European Parliament Report on Civil Law rules on robotics;
• The European Commission Consultation on the evaluation of procedural and jurisdictional aspects of EU merger control;
• The actions related to "boosting competitiveness through interoperability and innovation" as foreseen by the DSM Communication; and
• The European Commission Communication titled "Towards a modern, more European copyright framework," and the various actions it foresees.
